summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P5270.11) detailing the policies and procedures for the operation of Special Housing Units (SHUs), including administrative detention and disciplinary segregation. It outlines inmate placement criteria, review processes, conditions of confinement, and staff training requirements. The document is a standard BOP policy update and contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein or his case.

events.title: Issuance of BOP Program Statement P5270.11
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons issues an updated policy statement on the operation of Special Housing Units (SHUs), rescinding the previous 2011 policy.

keyFacts: This is a standard Bureau of Prisons policy document (Program Statement P5270.11) on Special Housing Units, not a case-specific document related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The policy defines two statuses for inmates placed in SHUs: administrative detention (non-punitive) and disciplinary segregation (punitive).
It includes specific protections, such as restrictions on placing pregnant, post-partum, or recently miscarried inmates in restrictive housing.
The policy mandates regular reviews of inmate status in SHU, including reviews at 3 days, 7 days, and every 30 days.
It details conditions of confinement, including standards for clothing, bedding, food, hygiene, exercise, and access to medical/mental health care.
